body.name: Tell me to stop: Dark enemies to lovers secret billionaire identity romance (Tell Me Series Book 1)
body.description: From USA Today Bestselling Author Charlotte Byrd comes a twisted dark steamy romance of secret billionaire identities, enemies to lovers, decadence and debt.I owe him a debt. The kind money can’t repay. He wants something else: me, for one year.But I don’t even know who he is…365 days and nights doing everything he wants…except that.“I’m not going to sleep with you,” I say categorically. He laughs.“I’m going to make you a promise,” his eyes challenge mine.“Before our time is up, you’ll beg me for it.”From 1.5+ million books bestselling author Charlotte Byrd comes an extra steamy romance featuring forbidden love, enemies to lovers, secret billionaire identity. This is book 1 of a completed series. This series ends with a happily ever after._____________________________________________What readers are saying about Charlotte Byrd:"Extremely captivating, sexy, steamy, intriguing, and intense!” ★★★★★"Addictive and impossible to put down.” ★★★★★“I can’t get enough of the turmoil, lust, love, drama and secrets!” ★★★★★“Fast-paced romantic suspense filled twists and turns, danger, betrayal and so much more.” ★★★★★“Decadent, delicious, & dangerously addictive!” ★★★★★_____________________________________________*Beware of spoilers in the reviews below that are without spoiler alerts.* Read more

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: I owe him a debt. The kind money can’t repay. He wants something else: me, for one year.But I don’t even know who he is… 365 days and nights doing everything he wants…except that. “I’m not going to sleep with you,” I say categorically. He laughs. “I’m going to make you a promise,” his eyes challenge mine. “Before our time is up, you’ll beg me for it.” From 1.5+ million books USA Today bestselling author Charlotte Byrd comes an extra steamy romance featuring forbidden love, enemies to lovers, secret billionaire identity. This is book 1 of a completed series. This series ends with a happily ever after.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 18, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Although I found the book slow and very difficult to get into, I enjoyed the story line. The characters stories of how they know each other and the story of her mother and her is very deep. This is a very good read and I can't wait for the next one.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 4, 2023
reviews.reviewText: I’m excited to see where this story line is heading.I have a feeling that I’m nowhere close to being correct in my theories.What does Nick actually do for a living?Did he set up her mom?What’s really going on 🤔

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 12, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Couldn't stop reading
reviews.reviewText: I read this book in two days because it was so good that I couldn't put it down! I'm going to download the entire series and I can't wait to hear where this story leads.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Quick read that ends in a cliffhanger
reviews.reviewText: Tell Me to Stop is an entertaining quick read that ends rather abruptly and will leave you wanting to read what happens next. If you decide to read this book, definitely plan to get the second one because it really gets more interesting at the end.Olive receives a mystery check in the mail that just so happens to be the exact amount of money she owes in student loans. Not knowing who sent the money or why Olive decides to deposit the check and hope for the best. The rest of the story involves learning who the mystery benefactor is as well as what they want, 365 days and nights with Olive.Overall, the main idea behind the book isn't new but it does have its own unique variation on the trope. One thing that really kind of turned me off from the book for a moment was when Olive is reading a scene from her favorite author's book which *just* so happens to be the author of this book, Charlotte Byrd. While I get that it is probably meant to be cutesy or tongue-in-cheek, it just didn't land very well for me. That being said, the story was actually engaging for me, even if it was short, and I will definitely be continuing on with the second part of the story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 30, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Wow. I lived page by page. Literally addicting and great book series!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 26, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Better than expected
reviews.reviewText: Based on the description, my hopes were not high for this one. I just finished a book that was so unrealistic it was annoying. I expected the same from this, but, I was pleasantly surprised. It was an easy read and kept my attention through the entire thing.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 16, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 2.0 out of 5 stars I read the whole series: Things I liked and Things I didn’t
reviews.reviewText: Things I liked:I did like that this series is made up of 6 novellas. They are short and end with a little cliff hanger leaving you wanting more. I liked the intrigue of the first book’s storyline; Mystery man sends mystery gift, his intentions unknown, etc… Our heroine goes to Hawaii with her best friend to meet him and find out who he is and what he wants from her.Things I didn’t like: (Spoilers ahead!)#1 Did anyone edit these books? So much of the writing is clunky and awkward, and there are so many distracting inconsistencies in the narrative (for example: ‘she leaned across the picnic table to kiss him’; in the next sentence ‘she puts her head on his shoulder’. What?)#2 Self-Indulgent author who more than once has the heroine mention that Charlotte Byrd her favorite writer.#3 The character of Josephine is practically Byrd herself. She’s written as someone who is an author of romance/suspense books and goes on and on about independent publishing and how to write a good story. Even Josephine’s husband used to be her writing partner just like Byrd’s.#4 Lazy planning out of the story.Hero: ‘I need to find someone who can crack a safe.’ Heroine: ‘I’ve never told anyone this but I happen to be an expert safe cracker with all the equipment needed because I worked my way through college as a cat burglar only to take a boring desk job and struggle to make ends meet after college.’ Really?#5 Lazy writing, using the same descriptions and phrases over and over and over again: If I read, ‘She wiped her tears with the back of her hand’ one more time, I was going to throw my Kindle across the room.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 10, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Easy and fun read
reviews.reviewText: Love they way the book is written. Easy to read and hard to put down. Would recommend it to anyone
5 Stars for this book. I love this author's books and this series delivered. It was fast-paced, suspenseful, well-written, and steamier than a hot, hot, hot shower!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 12, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A surprise check comes through my mailbox, the exact amount to pay off my student loans, I just needs to work out where the money has come from and what to do next. Can’t wait to read book two
So far this is a good book. Let's see if the rest of this series is good too. Okay .

How is this erotica? There's nothing arousing, erotic, or even remotely interesting in this book. Much of it doesn't even make sense and the author can't keep track of her own timeline.A waste of time.

So. I like to think that I'm not particularly picky when reading this book genre, but I'd still like a smooth narrative style, and a basic story. I'm sorry: this story really is terrible, boring, and not well written at all, despite the luring title and catchy summary on the back of the cover.It's all about the poorly written main character's personal drama up to page 175, with close to zero interaction between the guy and the girl. Then, out of the blue, and totally unrelated, you find a sex chapter. And then the next chapter goes back to the girl's personal drama with no trace of the guy. I double and triple checked if it was a mistake in printing the book itself but the page numbers' order is fine! And it's not a sudden change of mind of one of the characters, the guy and the girl are in two different places so it's really impossible.Again, boring to the bone, no interaction between the two main characters at all besides the "here's the money, do me a favor" "yes for the money, no thanks for the favor" lines...... absolutely no sparkle. Not a hint.Personally, a waste of time, money and paper.
